qas.question: What were some different genres that emerged from ancient India's oral literary traditions?

answers.text: drama, fables, sutras and epic poetry

qas.question: An important language for ancient Indian literature is what?
What ancient religious scriptures were among the first examples of Indian literature?
The Vedic Period refers to what expanse of time?

answers.text: the mid 2nd to mid 1st millennium BCE

qas.question: The Vedic Period began in the Late Bronze Age and extended until when?
Sanskrit literature begins with what that dates back to 1300-1100 BCE?
The early genres of Ancient India included drama, tragedy, fables, and what other two genres?
What literature follows the Vedas in Iron Range India?

plausible_answers.text: the Late Bronze Age and the Iron Age

qas.question: The Vedic period spans the mid 3rd to mid 1st millennium BCE, also known as what?
The time between the 6th and 5th centuries BC saw the composition and redaction of what?

plausible_answers.text: from stories that were originally orally transmitted

qas.question: How did literature originate in ancient China?
What does Sanskrit literature end with?
When does the redirection of the Samhitas date to?
What dates back to the years 1005-100 BCE?
What period spans the late 2nd to mid 1st millennium BCE?

plausible_answers.text: the composition and redaction of the two most influential Indian epics, the Mahabharata and the Ramayana

qas.question: What did the period between the 2nd and 1st centuries BC see?

context: In ancient India, literature originated <b10_0>from stories that were originally orally transmitted<b10_0/>. Early genres included <a0_0>drama, fables, <b6_0>sutras and epic poetry<b6_0/><a0_0/>. <a1_0>Sanskrit<a1_0/> literature begins with <b11_0><b14_0>the <b5_0>Vedas<b14_0/><b11_0/><b5_0/>, dating back to 1500–1000 BCE, and continues with the <b7_0>Sanskrit Epics<b7_0/> of Iron Age India. <a2_0>The Vedas<a2_0/> are among the oldest sacred texts. <b12_0>The Samhitas<b12_0/> (vedic collections) date to roughly 1500–1000 BCE, and the "circum-Vedic" texts, as well as <b15_0>the redaction of the Samhitas<b15_0/>, date to c. <b13_0>1000-500 BCE<b13_0/>, resulting in a <b16_0>Vedic period<b16_0/>, spanning <a3_0>the mid 2nd to mid 1st millennium BCE<a3_0/>, or <b8_0>the Late Bronze Age and <a4_0>the Iron Age<b8_0/><a4_0/>. The period between approximately the 6th to 1st centuries BC saw <b17_0>the composition and redaction of the two most influential Indian epics, <b9_0>the Mahabharata and the Ramayana<b17_0/><b9_0/>, with subsequent redaction progressing down to the 4th century AD.
